channel.title: Comments on: Leaving Bloglines For Google Reader

item.title: By: Robert Eastman
item.dc:creator: Robert Eastman
item.description: I do not understand Bloglines. I have been begging them for a verification email for months - at least 3 requests. What do I get? Bupkus. I have therefore sent two requests to Customer Service asking for a verification email. What have I gotten so far? Bupkus. I am going to suggest that they send it to me by carrier pigeon. That is, if I ever hear from them. (And yes, i did enter the correct email address.)
item.content:encoded: I do not understand Bloglines. I have been begging them for a verification email for months – at least 3 requests. What do I get? Bupkus. I have therefore sent two requests to Customer Service asking for a verification email. What have I gotten so far? Bupkus. I am going to suggest that they send it to me by carrier pigeon. That is, if I ever hear from them. (And yes, i did enter the correct email address.)

item.title: By: Laura Moncur
item.dc:creator: Laura Moncur
item.description:
Thank you for writing this.
I felt the EXACT same way when I abandoned Bloglines in favor of Google Reader. I didn't particularly care for the usability of Google Reader, but I just couldn't deal with the frustrations of Bloglines anymore.
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for writing this.

I felt the EXACT same way when I abandoned Bloglines in favor of Google Reader. I didn’t particularly care for the usability of Google Reader, but I just couldn’t deal with the frustrations of Bloglines anymore.
